topic.title: Embedding Diagrams in DITA topics using PlantUML

body.p: PlantUML is a neat library which takes textual descriptions of diagrams and produces visual diagrams from them.
Suppose you have a DITA topic which embeds such a textual description of a diagram: .

In order to provide support in Oxygen for using such diagrams in DITA topics you need to install the following components:
An Oxygen plugin which presents PlantUML textual descriptions as images when editing the content in the Author visual editing mode: .
A DITA Open Toolkit publishing plugin which once installed in the DITA Open Toolkit will convert the textual descriptions to diagrams both for the HTML-based and for the PDF outputs: .
Once you have this setup you can both visualize the diagrams when editing and you can publish and have the diagram representations dynamically converted to SVG in the published output.
